list_definition.definition: (of or done by) a person who is working on his own, not for any one employer

list_ex_of_english: There were strong preferences for freelancing as a final but indefinite phase of work.
If there is a distinction between amateur and professional journalists, there must be a distinction between staff journalists and freelances.
In contrast, the ' creatives' tended to pursue the imaginative or artistic element of their work by freelancing, which they combined with part-time posts that provided some financial security.
He also freelanced for nearly every major comic book publisher.
He is the author of five non-fiction books dealing with topics from online creativity to freelancing, incorporating aspects of empathy and business.
Secondly, the industry uses freelances a great deal, and if there is no solid core of training more freelances will be used.
The rest of the year, he freelanced as a clown at birthday parties and special events.
Kuijers freelanced briefly as a designer and illustrator, but now paints full-time.
